FuncDef:
The sub-port-queue command creates or displays a sub-interface queue profile.
The undo sub-port-queue command deletes a sub-interface queue profile.
By default, no sub-interface queue profile is created in the system.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a sub-interface queue.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
After a sub-interface queue profile is created using the sub-port-queue command, you can set scheduling parameters for it. When a sub-interface queue applies for resources, parameters in the profile are used to schedule all user traffic on the sub-interface.
Before using the sub-port-queue command, note the following:
If the sub-interface queue profile specified by sub-port-queue-name does not exist, the system creates a new sub-interface queue profile.If the profile specified by sub-port-queue-name exists, the sub-interface queue profile view is displayed. You can modify the sub-interface queue profile.

Configuration Impact
A sub-interface queue profile that is bound to an interface or sub-interface cannot be deleted.
Precautions
You can configure a maximum of 100 sub-interface queue profiles in the system.
